profile_positions.description:
	Supervised Regional Management Team and oversaw the day to day operations of 48 internal staff working with sixty-eight (68) partner organizations.
	Oversaw Western U.S. regional marketing and sales initiatives for overseas markets focused on boosting customer base and revenue 
	Managed multi-million-dollar budget and finances for entire Western U.S. Operations  
	Developed and secured New Partnerships and Agreements both domestically and abroad
	Determined need for projects and process improvements, delegated tasks, controlled deadlines, tracked progress, and guided and supported all team members until completion
	Independently worked on senior level cross-departmental projects and rolled out company-wide policies based on needs identified by C-level management and VPs. 
	Hired, determined salary rate, trained, led, and oversaw the company’s Program Management team responsible for the marketing and promotion of partners and the recruitment and enrollment of international customers 
	Regularly interfaced with overseas agents and Management of Overseas Service Groups
	Well versed in Partnership Negotiations and creating individualized marketing and recruitment plans to ensure targets are met
Career Highlights: 
	Instrumental in development and implementation of company restructure and standardization of regional operations including change policies that spanned across multiple departments and international offices
	Hired multiple positions for West Coast Operations following company restructure, including school management, staff management positions, dormitory operations staff, student support staff, and language support.
profile_positions.title: Director of Program Operations

profile_positions.description:
	Oversaw the entire operations of international student recruitment, admissions processing; student interviews; i-20 and visa processing; student travel and arrival coordination; homestay arrangements; and year-round student support for 71 secondary schools and 3 higher education institutions
	Supervised the performance of the West Coast U.S. Team consisting of supporting team members with school consultation and advisement, recruitment strategies, marketing, problem solving, and student support
	Assumed full responsibility for new school outreach and partnership agreement negotiations for secondary and post-secondary schools
	Managed the Admissions Team and was responsible for facilitating regular training of staff and maintaining coordination between China and the United States’ operations 
	Spearheaded the West Coast Office during the company’s re-structure through systematic training sessions, workshops, individual meetings with staff, and direct meetings with all school partners
Career Highlights: 
	Received the Best Support Award in 2016 by implementing efficient company-wide admissions and enrollment processes leading into the company restructure and advising all Program Operations upper management and company’s CEO on cross functional procedures 
	Completed three-month assignment in Chengdu, China, with responsibilities of streamlining operational admissions processes; handling employee evaluations, terminations, and recruitment; establishing and conducting employee and management training workshops; as well as implementing employee incentive and bonus programs for 46 staff members of the Admissions Team to improve staff retention rates
profile_positions.title: Associate Director of Program Operations

profile_positions.description:
	Monitored the performance of 6 educational consultants while overseeing 53 international school programs over 6 US states, consisting of more than 900 students for Fall 2014
	Directed the training for the 40-person Admissions Team and travelled to Chengdu, China to facilitate evaluations with all team leaders; create PIPs for poor performing employees; identify candidates for termination; interview admissions associate candidates; as well as examine and enhance existing team lead functions using tracking methods for respective focus areas
	Visited school administration and faculty on site to provide direct support, resolve conflicts, negotiate contracts or any other managerial backing needed by Consultant Team during training or escalation 
	Functioned as the interim office manager, in charge of property management, office event planning, human resources training, International Student Exchange Visitor Placement Organizations (ISEVPO) and Attorney General’s Office of California communication, California Interscholastic Federation (CIF) communications, and office supplies purchasing
Career Highlights: 
	Obtained the Excellence Award in 2014 and the Rising Star Award in 2015 by consistently performing at a high level, growing the West Coast Region including number of staff and Partner schools, as well as being the fastest employee in the history of the company to advance to Team Lead position
	Traveled to China for the Beijing Office training and meetings, various agency visits across five major cities, and school official chaperoning
profile_positions.title: Program Management Team Lead

profile_positions.description:

	Determined and resolved problems, and streamlined processes and support system for diverse “difficult partners”
